text: Black. Roasted malty aroma with spices, coffee notes and cocoa. Malty and highly roasted flavour, with spices and chili. Dryish taste that finishes rather bitter, with burnt malt, ash and more chili. Full body. Overall, a decent spiced porter. Seeems unbalanced and not that drinkable. Too dry and too bitter. I think Texas Ranger is a lot better than this one.

750 mL bottle. Black body with an enormous mocha head. Smells creamy, roasty, spicy. Nice. Tastes spicy and peppery, sweet chocolate, creamy and roasty in equal portions. Nicely bitter in the back end. Medium body and creamy. Clearly, I do not get the individual ingredients, because what the hell does avocado leaf taste like? But it works.

Dark....dark....dark....very flavorful! A bit harsh on your first drink but quickly grows on you. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

W aromacie można było wyczuć papryczki, migdały oraz kakao. W smaku pojawiały się czekoladowo-kawowe motywy, były też papryczki. Ogólnie piwo było dość mocno palone, z ziołowo liściastą goryczką. Zostawiało też na języku lekki fasolowy posmak.

Bottle at home. Black with a dark brown head, nice lacings. Aroma heavy malty (roasted, burnt, spices, chili, dark chocolate), medium hoppy. Flavor medium+ sweet, spicy, chocolate, warming chilies, ending bitter. Full body, creamy and smooth, soft carbonated.

Bottle. 
Very Dark Brown pour, small tan head. 
Roasted malty Nose. Taste is sweet as first, then hints of chocolate and chili. 
Not bad.
backlog. Pachnie mleczną czekoladą, kawą i prażony słonecznikiem, smak: mocno wytrawnie kawowo, konkretnie nachmielone, gorzkie kakao, chilli delikatnie rozgrzewają na finiszu. Dobre.

The aroma is spices, chili, chocolate, very interesting. Pours very dark almost black with big light brown head fully diminishing and excellent lacing. The taste is a little sweet, sour then bitter. The body is full, the texture creamy, the carbonation lively and the finish bitter. Very Good!!
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.

Bottle 0.33L.
Dark brown-to-black body with a huge, frothy, brown head, mostly lasting with nice lacing.
Moderate-to-heavy malty (roasted) aroma with notes of coffee, dark chocolate, chili, spices and some (red) fruits.
Moderate-to-heavy sweet and moderate bitter flavour with a long lasting "chili" (in the throat) finish.
Medium body with oily texture; soft carbonation.
A pleasant surprise!

Bottle 33cl at Honoloeloe.
Pours black, with a lovely beige dense head. The head sticks to the glass. Looks full bodied when pouring.
Aroma of cocoa, dark chocolat, a bit spicy in the end, chorizo.
Taste is clear cocoa, a coffee beans, the bitterness comes slowly. More milky when it warms up. Reminds me of chewing on a bean.
Full bodied, yet not sweet sticky, bitter like coffee in the end.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Fajna czekolada, wanilia, kremowe ciało, lekko pikantny finisz. Świetne.

Pours dark as a moonless cloud-covered night. Makes a thick, frothy brown head, which dissipates down in a about a minute. Be patient and let it settle because you won't get the aroma until that head is almost gone. Then you will be rewarded with the smell of cocoa, horchata, chili peppers and brown sugar. The taste is similar, but with some roasted barley and even a bit of blackstrap molasses in the mix. What a treat! These Belgians are indeed artists. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fluffy, brown sugar coloured head stayed well on a jet black still body. 
Spicy, peppery aroma with malt & bitterness. 
Very smooth on the palate, crisp but a bit thin on the back. 
Vanilla, cream, coffee & brown sugar to the fore followed by a peppery, spicy, tangy, hoppy back & a long chilli aft.

330ml bottled 2016-05-09. Pour pitch black with a dense creamy dark tan head. Aroma is from roasted malt, spice and herbs. Taste of dark coffee, dark malt and yes chilies. Medium to full body, oily feel, average carbonation, long bitter finish. I have a problem with the Spice/Herb/Vegetable classification, this beer is a Stout with more ingredients, thats all !!!

On tap at Oblivion Taproom, sane group, pours a dark black pour with a small beige head. Nose is chocolate with nice spice. Taste is bitter, with malt and some smoke and ends on the same tasting notes with a long bitter smoky finish . Quaff Score 7 / 10

On tap at Oblivion Taproom. Pours black with a Brown head and aroma of roasted malt, sweet chocolate, and spices. Taste is strong roasted malt notes up front, with burnt, sweet chocolate notes, along with spices leading to a roasty finish.

Pours pitch black, topped with a sizeable and pretty lasting dark geige head. Nice chocolate and cocoa nose upfront. Some hoppy notes in the back, and a touch of chili presence. Creamy, quite full body. Starts with a sweet touch and finishes with medium bitterness, aftertaste a bit more roasty. Nicely drinkable, though expected some more chili heat from it, which comes in moderate measure very late.

Black opaque with big light brown head. Aroma of soy sauce, umami, cocoa, vanilla, oak, almonds, roasted pepper, salinity. Very very complex, Im eager to try! Taste is similar not much difference, just different balance. Aftertaste is mainly roasted malts, not a hint of bitterness.Very smooth, amazing brew!

Black pour with a red and brown head. Intersting look. Smells intensely like chocolate and chili pepper. Very thick and with a bizarre flavour, nutty and spicy, texture kind of pulsates on the tongue, a modern art beer.
Had a really strong mocha flavor and was really easy to drink. Like a chocolate horchatta.

bottle drunk at home. love beers with chili, wasnt sure what to expect from this with all the wacky ingredients. pours black with a tan head, thick creamy lacing. great aroma of nuts, allspice mix. tastes of chili, vanilla, chocolate, bitter hoppy finish. creamy slick medium body. chili wasnt huge, but the flavours were balanced and i actually liked the herby veggy notes in there

Listado de ingredientes infinito para una cerveza en la que destacan principalmente el cacao y el chile, tanto en boca como en nariz. De color negro, coronada por una buena capa de espuma beige con buena retención y que deja encaje en la copa. Bastante cuerpo (normal con tanto añadido) y con un final amargo, seco y duradero. Buena!
Aparte de esto este estilo (Spice/Herb/Vegetable) es un cajón desastre, porque esta cerveza es sencillamente una stout especiada. 
BB 2020/03/01

Whoa, suhmooootth. Perfectly balanced. Appearances Pitch Black with a 10 thick head that lasts a long time and lots of lace. Aroma is roast cocoa vanilla spiced almonds chili and a little funk maybe some yeast. Flavors a little like nose chili comes out a little bit more. Smooth as a con artist. Man this is good.

Очень вкусный напиток, шикарны& аромат, красива& темная пена, отличны& мощный вкус и в послевк& реально ощущает& жжение перчика. Аромато& и вкусом напомин& хороший мощный портер или стаут. Срок годност& до 01.03.20. (Bottle 0,33/ 6,6%)

Bottle. Pitch black with a mostly fading bubbly dark brown head. Aroma is of dark chocolate, chili, hint of vanilla, earthy. Taste is of dark chocolate, roasted, hint of nuts, warming chili kick on the finish. Sticky oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

0.33 bottle @ Valentin - Curious Bierkneipe, Volos Greece
Nice experiment, but not that much fun to enjoy. Appearance is black, with a dark brown thick head, aromas of coffee and cocoa. Low to medium carbonation, light to medium body but with a complex taste. In the beginning sweet, then a hint of chilli. ending with cocoa and a bitter finish, in the aftertaste the bean and / or avocado, that wasnt -for me- tastefull.
Delicious dark beer. Slightly spicy but not overly so and very rich. The chocolate really comes through however not sure what the beans really add. Its a really great drink.

330ml bottle. Pours pitch black with thick fluffy brown head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, smoke and all quite savoury. Flavour is smokey chipotle, dark chocolate, savoury earthiness and plenty of spice. The finish is hot but not too much. Really quite different and really nice.

V tomto pive sa premiela naozaj v?etko. Od jemne tlmených chutí, ktoré zrejme dávajú pou?ité suroviny ako fazu?a cez citrusy z chmelenia, a? po jemnú pikantnos? pou?itých papri?iek. ?akal som mo?no o trochu viac, ale aj ke? nie som fanú?ik tmavých pív, toto mi chutilo.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Tap at Salon piva. Expertly mixing assertive dark roasted malt flavours with light to moderate chilli. No paprika but real chilli. Easy drinking despite the full body. Great beer.

Pours dark thick an inky in look with a strange spiced smell. It tastes almost smoked dark and spiced with a rich oily texture with a little fizz. More stout like then I was expecting. This is an okay experiment for sure. Certainly a unique twist that is much less of a disaster then the ingredient list suggests it could be.

On tap at Only Good Beer, Budapest. Nose is coffee. Body is pitch black, head is small, brownish, creamy, mostly diminishing, excellent lacing. Aroma is smoked wood, roasted malt, cocoa, dark roasted coffee. Light sweet, medium to heavy bitter. Finish is long lasting roasty heavy bitter, smoke stays, developing hoppy bitterness. Medium to full body, slick slightly sticky texture, soft carbonation. Quite easy dessert beer, interesting, tasty, great one.

Pours oily black with a thick, beige foam head. Interesting nose, traditional black thick black chocolate, some roast, plus more exotic notes. Medium sweet flavor with plenty of dark chocolate, tobacco, charred malts, burnt earth, very faint chili peppers. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Lightly warming finish with some hard alcohol sting, moderate smokey and roasted dark malts, still more dark chocolate. Well balanced and pretty tasty

330 ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Black color with brown head. Roasted malty aroma, coffee, chocolate, cocoa, bread, some hoppy notes, some vegetables, spicy notes. Sweet and bitter tgaste like aroma but more spicy. Medium oily silky body with soft carbonation.

Bottle sample at a Mikkeller tasting at Beer and Beyond, Tel Aviv. Opaque black with brown head. The aroma has lots of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, some chili and some spiciness. Sweetish flavor followed by bitterness, notes of dark chocolate, some ash, roasted malt, chili (a bit hot), creamy, herbs, nuts, some spiciness. Oily texture, sticky, medium to full-bodied. Very nice.

Pours a very dark brown with a medium light brown head that fades kind of fast but leave good lacing. Nose is chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, chili. Smoke. Not as "mole-like" as one could hope but still pretty nice. Taste is not that sweet but still moderately with a moderately light bitterness. Roasted malt, chili heat, light lactose, chocolate. Body is medium, carbonation moderate and mouthfeel is pretty smooth. Bitter finish, maybe from some hops or maybe just the intense roasted malt? Almost ashy. Spices are well dosed but do enhance the perceived alcohol level. A pretty good chili stout, I dont think I would go back to it, though. I believe it could have been much better!
Beautiful big brown head, aroma of chili, herbs, hops, chocolate malt. Taste bitternes with slighty sweet on the tongue, than chili notes. Long lasting palate.

This is a special one. Nice dessertbeer. Full of bittersweet chocolate and pleasantly spicey. Dont have a clue what the combination of almond milk, black beans and avocado leaves normally tastes like but here it works really well i guess. Weird but very pleasant experience.

Bottle (from Mikkeller webshop). Pours dark brown-black with brown head. The head stays. Aroma is chili, roast, dark chocolate, malt, smoke. Flavor is sweet and bitter, roast, smoke, tar, dark chocolate, chili, coffee. Finish is dark chocolate with chili. Overall: great brew.
Tap. Black, frothy, tan foam, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & long finish.

Bottle at Bishops Folkis.
Pitch black, nice and slightly porous spongy brown head.
Sweet chocolatey aroma with some chili and musty spice, dry dusty cocoa, something odd which could be the black beans. Quite sweet. Roastiness reminds of Yeti.
Taste is sweet and richly roasted with chocolate, dark berries and grapefruit, faint chili heat, some tar. Sweet.
Soft round mouthfeel, medium big to full body, silky, slight syrupy.
Sweet snd tasty, but maybe a tad old bottle cause the chilies and spices where kind of muted.

21052016. Bottle @ Mikkeller San Francisco.Dark brown to black color with medium brown head. Aroma is spicy with roasted malts, some and dark coffee. Balanced roasty body, some chilis burning, coffee, chocolate.Nice brew.

Dune bouteille à un verre. Bière noire et opaque avec un large col beige. Au nez, ce quon aime dune stout; café bien torréfié. On sent également un petit quelque chose dépicé. En bouche, lintensité des notes rôties domine. On sent cependant que tout ça est adouci par quelque chose de plus doux (horchata?). La finale surprend. Cest épicé et on goûte le cacao. Em weirdos they be good at it.

300th rating! On tap at hopaholic. Pitch black colour huge brown microfoam. Nice roased malts and smooooth bitterness in the taste, but nothing outsanding and cant really feel the special herbs added.

Whoa!
Jet black, high beige head, siropy. Aroma dried prunes, chocolate. Medium palate, low carbonation. Thick, oily and rich with taste. Everything goes together and reminds me of freshly brewed, flavor-packed nice espresso (piccollo) - a taste bomb. Nice sweet finish with slight chilli warmth. Very good.

Bottle from Yeme. Black colour with stable beige head. Complex aroma, roasted, coffee, chocolate, caramel, spicy, espresso. Taste is roasted, initially sweet, coffee, chocolate. Roasted dry taste. Caramel. Roasted aftertaste. Very complex and very good.

33cl bottle at home. Dark brown with a medium slightly off-white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Herbal bitterness with subtle sweet tones. Chocolate, spices, caramel, coffee, some hops and herbs. Nice!

Bottle 33cl
@ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
A: Black.
T: Roasted malt, spicy, slightly hoppy.

Jan. 16. On tap at Craft Room, Zagreb, admittedly the last drops of the barrel so it might have been impaired. It poured pitch black body with medium sized brown head atop. Weak aroma of dark malts like cocoa, licorice, chocolate, nuts. Flavor was lightly sweet roasted malt, cocoa, coffee, licorice, wood, some spices. Pleasant but very weak really. Thin in body with short finish with smooth cocoa and similar, already mentioned subtle things. Way too light, not impressive at all! Despite all of the nice notes.Then Im thinking again how it might be in a bad shape, I might try it again bottled some day, but Im too grudging to risk and pay, what, like 10 euros for it in beershops, not even talking about the bars.
Bottle. Pours black with medium tan head that lasts. The aroma is peppers, smoke, roast, spice. Thin body, lots of peppers and spice, smoke, chocolate, nice heat in the finish, very good.

Pours oily black, clear, with creamy long lasting brown head. Aroma: dark malt aroma, which takes on espresso coffee, chococolate, cooca powder, biscuit, vanilla beans, chilli, some spices, pine, citruses etc. Very similar are flavors, with notes of espresso coffee, supported with cocoa, milk chocolate, mexican cake, vanilla, spices. Finish is slightly bitter and with gentle chilli burn, with some fruity notes of hops. Body is moderate full, texture is velvety, carbonation is low.

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is lots of pepper, some cocoa, coffee, roasted malt, smoke. Appearance is dark dark brown, brown head, poured pretty thick. Taste is deep roasted malt, pepper, coffee, not much else, robust malt maybe. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy body, light carbonation, pepper and coffee aftertaste. Overall, this one is pretty disappointing.

330 mL bottle shared by ebone1988. Thanks, I guess. The pour is a thick and oily black with a thin ring of dark khaki head and some pretty Spotify lace all over as it falls. The aroma is strange. There is a lot of smoke and pepper heat right up front. There is a little maltiness to it, but its really forward on smoke and pepper heat. This should be something I guess. The flavor is, well, very disappointing. There is a metallic malt and a strong pepper, but it falls off after that. The finish is where the smoke comes back in, but its light and boring. The mouth feel is thick and heavy. There is a soft, chewy carbonation and a lingeringly light smoke and pepper presence on the back end. Its interesting, and could be a lot better.

A deep dark stout with a thin lacing mocha head. In aroma, sweet fruity dark chocolate malt with light vanilla, light chili, coffee grind, light bourbon barrel notes, very nice. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity chocolate malt with light pepper, light grassy hops, coffee grind, musty character, nice and complex. On tap at Mikkeller and Friends, Reykjavik.

Courtesy of Jaghana. Couleur noire, très légère mousse. Nez grain de café, houblonné résineux, pimenté. Gout de café, grain de café, reglisse, assez houblonné avec forte épices et piment en fin de bouche puis fin grillée. Trop sur le piment a mon gout.
Bottle. Dark color. Medium thick brown head. Taste is medium sweet, light to medium bitter. Medium body. Aroma is chili, roasted, chocolate.

On tap. Jet black with nice brown head and quite good lacing. Aromas of coffee, little bit chololate and spices. First sips with little heat, then lightly sweet with bitterness in the finish. Medium to full body, creamy with very pleasant mouth feel. Well done!
Bardzo dobry porter. W zapachu lekko palony, malo intensywny. Smak lekko slodki, czekoladowy, srednio pelny.

Bottle 33cl, a dark beer with medium brown head. Nose is on hops resin, licorice, dark coffee. Aroma is on dark coffee, quite hopy, touch of spices, grain, vegetable notes, strong roast notes, did not get the avocado.

Une mousse brune onctueuse pleine de grosses bulles se sauve toutefois rapidement dune bière noire et opaque. Du cacao est supporté par des notes végétales (piments) et dautres arômes majoritairement épicés mais parfois sucrés. En bouche, on retrouve sensiblement les mêmes éléments, mais avec une prédominance de la combinaison "chocolat et épices". Un peu de tabac et une longue finale qui picote la langue caractérisent également cette bière singulière.
Bottle(s). With fresh corn tortilla tacos. Pours pitch black with a beige head. A perfectly pitched chili aftertaste. Works amazing with real Mex food. Also great by itself.

Je verse dans mon verre ballon ce liquide parfaitement noir qui coule lourdement en formant une tête dun brun obscur me laissant anticiper une forte torréfaction. Cette tête fond heureusement rapidement, faute de quoi le liquide aurait été inaccessible. Des arômes végétales, de chocolat noir et amer, dépices et de chipotle. Rares sont le bière noires aussi faibles en alcool qui présentent tant de rondeur et de complexité. Une pétillance en bouche qui atténue un corps généreux. Saveurs sèches très amères, encore une fois très herbacées sur fond de cacao poudreux et de piment presque fumé, à la manière du chipotle. Belle prolongation de larrière-goût malgré une attaque brusque et fugace telle un feu de paille. Somme toute une bière qui se boit très bien malgré son intensité et un profil aromatique particulier.
Bottle to glass. Nose is very earthy. Dirty. Light vegetable. Nearly black with light brown head. Taste is minty, vanilla, cocoa. Lots going on but it doesnt seem to come together well. Muddy.

Inky black pour with a thin tan head. Amazing nose of sour tart notes with roasty earthy cocoa notes, with some coffee and perhaps some boysenberry. Lovely flavor with some sour tones throughout and some light boysenberry/or blackberry tones, some coffee, tartness, lots of roasty stout tones, and a tart berry finish with a little coffee..just a little. Really nice.

Pours black with good beige head. Aroma dominated by chocolate and a touch of Berry fruits. Taste is strong chocolate and coffee, nice bitter finish with a bit of heat which grows sip on sip. Great mouth feel forth the low ish abv

330ml bottle, pours dark with a dark foamy head. Aroma is rich chocolate malt, wood smoke, chilli, zesty orange. Full bodied with a creamy texture, lightly sweet to start with balance coming from the smoke, finish ends with chilli heat, orange peel zest and mild bitterness. Carbonation is soft to spritzy. Excellent.

Bouteille de 330 ml obetenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie (Montréal, QC). Arôme: Odeur de cacao avec une pointe dépices. Apparence: La couleur est noire opaque. Présence dun moyen col brun mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de cacao avec une pointe dépices et de torréfaction. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de cacao en arrière goût. (Rating #6826)
Bottle from work. This was a good one. Definitely spicy, semi lively Belgian style head, smokey, tar, peated leather, leafy and peppery but well balanced. Nothing going too extreme.

Pours black with a tan head. Licorice, black bean, cinnamon, chocolate, and spice aroma. Black bean, roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, licorice, spice, chili and maybe avocado leaf (never had to compare) flavors. Medium full body and moderate carbonation. Black bean, chocolate and spice finish. Very weird.

33cl bottle, served in tulip glass. Pitch black colour with nice tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, wood, coffee and dark fruits. The flavour is the same with spices, so well balanced, although it is very difficult to guess at first that theres chili in there. After a few minutes, it is possible to get something (very subtle). The chocolate dominates. The aftertaste is dry with good retention of the spices and a slight chili touch. Full mouthfeel, perfect carbonation. Great brew.
On draught. Pours black with a moderate tan head. Nose is coffee, chocolate and chili. Taste follows. Very nice.

6.6%ABV. Porter

Tapped out black. 40ºSRM.

Nose is rich with the following aromas: smoke, chocolate, coffee, charcoal, mesquite, burnt sugar, wheaty with wheat germ sweetness. Brief wheat floury flatbed to the nose. The nose also has some smoky spiciness to it, like a grilled chili pepper. There is also a buttery richness to the nose like a torched macadamia or a burnt candlenut. Will come back to the nose again when the beers warmed a bit more...molasses, brown sugar, hint of boiling cane syrup funk, wam honey, medicinal nose, almost like liniment.

Mouthfeel is thick and soapy with a little spicy bite at the top of the mouth with the first slug and then at the back of the throat. Palate has chocolate, coffee, charcoal, stewed fruit, sweet ripe stone fruit, dates, and maybe a little yakitori like umami-sweet-spice. The spice is bell peppers, poblanos, ancho and some smoked or preser4ved chilies. 

Finsh is sweet and ume with a hint of smoke. Like enjoying a pipe especially with the hint of vanilla creaminess. 

Goes on Favorites List!
330 ml bottle. Dark black colour with brown nice colour. One of the nicest colour of beer i have ever seen. Aroma of coffee,nuts. Taste of coffee,slight notes of breans and spicy finish. Roasted. Wow
Tap at Mikkeller Tokyo. Nice milky and creamy, big spiciness, some roast and coffee. Chocolate too. Nice spice at end.

Bottle 0.33l at Majstor za pivo Belgrade Serbia. Taste with Ogi and Vlada 29.12.2015.Pour it dark color with small black head.Aroma of agressive chilli and some beans.Taste roasted malt, daek chocolate, vanilla, chilli, beans.After taste light hot spice.Ok interesting.

Tap at Mikkeller Tokyo. Roasted coffee and malt nose with some light pepper and a touch of sweetness present. Dry on the palate with good roasted espresso notes and hoppy bitterness. Not much sweetness on the palate really. Peppery finish with some cayenne pepper as it warms. Super complex for the abv and enjoyable.

Bottle thanks to flandersned. Thanks! The beer is a thick, viscous black with a khaki head of foam. The aroma has strong sweet malty character, a little roasty, and just a bit of pepper come through. Sweet and and very roasty. A prickle of heat on the backend. Thick mouthfeel. Medium carbonation.

Bottle from Saveur Biere cons 2016-02-14 Göteborg
AR: thick chocolate sause, coffey, rosted malt
AP: dark brown heavy denisity with ruby rim, high frothy/stouty thick foam
F: dark and bitter chocolate, black coffey, wee bit hollow, chili finish - long and lasting togheter with the heavy chocolate, dry

330 ml bottle into tulip glass, best before 10/14/2019. Pours dense pitch black color with a 2 finger dense and rocky dark brown bread with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Dense soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Incredible appearance. Aromas of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toasted dark bread, molasses, chili pepper, smoke, tobacco, nuttiness, light dark fruit/licorice, pine, light char, and herbal/roasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/roast/bready malt, cocoa/spice, and earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of huge dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toasted dark bread, molasses, chili pepper, smoke, tobacco, nuttiness, light dark fruit/licorice, pine, light char, and herbal/roasted earthiness. Good amount of roast/char/pine bitterness and pepper spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toasted dark bread, molasses, chili pepper, smoke, tobacco, nuttiness, light dark fruit/licorice, herbal, pine, and roast/char earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, cocoa/spice, and earthy hop flavors; with a good malt/bitter/spiciness balance and zero astringent flavors after the finish. Good amount of dryness from bitter/spiciness as well. Medium carbonation and fairly full bodied; with a very smooth, creamy/silky/chalky, and sticky/resinous balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Very minimal pepper heat as well. Overall this is an outstanding spiced American stout style. All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, cocoa/spice, and earthy hop flavors; and very smooth and easy to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.
Bottle shared with Ashton McCobb. Pours black with a thin tan head. Aromas are nutty, spicy, chocolate, green herbs. Taste is chocolate, smoky, fruity finish.

Bottle from Appellation Wines.
Appearance - deep dark and opaque with a nice fawn head. 
Nose - green, very herby, chocolate coming through too. 
Taste - sweet malt, cereal, nettles at the back. 
Palate - close to medium bodied with a tangy texture and a dry balanced finish.
Overall - complex and interesting.

Bottle. Pours black with a steady brown head. Beer is very rich, aromas and flavours of cocoa, chocolate, vanilla. Peppers present in the taste, very pleasing, absolutely not only for chilli heads. Pleasant oily texture and low caarbonation only keep this beer better and better. Very good stuff.

Amazing deep black color with thick and persistent brown head. Nose is chocolate, hops and roasted malts. Aromas are roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, a chili note. I guessed the black beans, but I definitely didn't get the almond milk and the avocado leaves (?!). Low carbonation, oily texture. Long bitter, roasty and hot finish. Intersecting and complex beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Extremely unique and thought provoking, Mexas Ranger is a U-turn on a style twisted upside down and inter-dimensionally...or some such superfluousness. One of the few beers I have had that forces my hands to type "umami", shades of charred meat mesh with hints of chocolate, vanilla, smokey chilies, burnt toffee and brown sugar. The carbonation is relaxed, the body slick, a sweet, salty and smokey finish remains. Not an everyday drinker, this well-crafted departure from the mundane is a treat to behold.

Bottle, 33cl. Opaque black pour with rich frothy lacy moka head. Aroma is smoky, roasted chili peppers, mexican chocolate, tons of cocoa, light roasted coffee notes, light caramel. Taste is sweet, good spicy/herbal flavors, nice bitterness, tons of powdery pure cocoa flavors. Palate is med-full bodied, nice and creamy with good carbonation. Taste stuff.

Tap @ Basement Beer Bar at Blackout Days, Aalborg. Aroma is moderate maltyness, chocolate, spicy, chili. Black with tan head, mostly diminishing. Light+ sweetness, moderate malt bitterness, chili hotness as well. Full body, oily texture, avg. carb., malt bitter and chili finish.

Black pour with tons of thick tan head and lots of lacing .... Aroma of cocoa, sweet milk, smoke, roasted malts and sweet moscovado sugar ..... Taste is spicy and of dry chilis, smoke, dry cocoa, sweet almond milk and roasted malts .... Finishes sweet and dry with lingering sugar and cocoa flavors and a smokey roastedness ..... Mouthfeel is slick and oily .... Body is thick and full

Black pour with a very thin brown head. Chocolate, roasty, coffee, burnt notes from the dark malt. Taste is roasty, smoky, dark chocolate, creamy. May be a tiny bit of warmth at the end but it might just be my imagination.

0.4 draft. Entirely black with a brown head of good retention leaving some lacing. Aroma is spicy, malty, a tad yeasty. Taste is both spicy and hot; malts are obviously present, roast too, sweet hot peppers play a secondary though noticeable role. A full body, a thick texture, and a soft carbonation. Finish is long and malty, somewhat fruity, featuring hints of coffee. Overall not a bad beer, much better than the standard set by the recent flooding of spicy miscreants.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2016 Spiced porter from Mikkeller, bottle bought online. Very thick, towering, dense, deep beige head leaving cobweb lacing on the edge of the glass; colour is an extremely dark burgundy brown, but completely black in appearance. Aroma of espresso beans, charcoal, tree bark, dried chili peppers, dusty old cocoa powder, dried thyme and bayleaf, green pepper, cedar wood, mocha ice cream, almond and even toasted coconut, smoked pipe tobacco, earthy black radish, raw potato, liquorice, black shoe polish phenols, black tea, dried mushrooms, caramel, toasted rye bread, natural iron. Quite intense onset of candied fig sweetishness, deep blackberry sourishness and, perhaps more than anything, beef stock umaminess; soft carbo, smooth but thick and oily body especially seen the ABV, deep and rich nutty and toasted malt bittersweetness leading to roasted coffeeish bitterishness aided by the peppery and herbal hop bitterness on the one hand and a subtle dried chili pepper burn on the other hand, functioning remarkably well together; alcohol remains completely hidden and a lovely black chocolatey and roasted malt bitterness remains in the throat after swallowing for a long time; so does a slight, subtle, weak chili burn, by the way. I do not get the avocado leaves at all but that is probably just because I have no idea how they are supposed to taste...  I love this: this beer is packed with flavour and a warming aroma.  For not even containing 7% ABV, it presents itself as thick, rich and vividly spicy - another Mikkeller masterpiece.

On tap at Craft Room, Opatovina, Zagreb, Croatia. Pitch black, coffee colored with brown head, big, diminishing but lasting. Hoppy, herbal, citrus, spicy, tequilla, some coffee aromas, too. Very complex, very hoppy, very bitter finish. Bitter chocolate and powdered cocoa. Creamy texture. Dry and bitter. Good but very bitter, too much for some maybe.

Black colored, medium dark tan creamy long lasting head, good lacing. Aroma is malty, caramel, chocolate and cocoa, slightly spice and chilly when warmer. Taste is medium+ sweet caramel malt, dark chocolate, roasted malt, some spices, bit milky, medium cocoa bitterness, some chilly in the finish and aftertaste with light chilly acidity. Medium+ bodied, soft carbonation, creamy.
(on tap, Craft Room, Zagreb)

Presented it today, on tap, at Craft Room. Pretty much pitch black body, with a brown-gray head, lasting. Full aroma, slightly herbal, but generally malty, chocolate and caramel. The taste is, especially as it warms, a well of complexity. Creamy, full, heavy with huge malts without being cloying, fresh herbal notes. Roasty notes, some hops, but not too much, various herbal notes showing up from time to time, presumably from the herbs added, certainly werent hoppy or from the chili - which basically shows up in the finish and in the aftertaste, helping create a warming feeling one would associate with a stronger beer. Great, complex beer. Certainly not anything resembling a session brew, but youll enjoy every sip of it!

Bottle in Belgrade-Serbia. Pours deep black color, tick brown head with medium retention and adhesive. Nose: quite smoky feel, burnt grains, aggressive notes of burnt malts, a bit milky with this pungent chili in the end. Mouth: round, rich, complexity of roasted malts. Chili is there but just a mild finish. Some nutty character, a bit too heavy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle. Pours black with a resilient deep beige head. Aroma is dark chocolate, spice. Flavor is chocolate, hazelnut, vanilla and almond. Finish is chocolate, coffee, light chili, some vegetable. Lingering bean, menthol. Medium to full body, soft mouthfeel and average carbonation.

Bottle (330 ml) at home. Dark brown with a medium beige head, good retention, leaving nice lacing. Aroma is of chocolate, roasted malt, molasses, mild chilies, herbal/grassy notes and mild peppery notes. Taste is slightly sweet and a tiny bit acidic with loads of chocolate, nutty notes, grassy/herbal presence, roasted malt, mild chili and peppery presence, citrus notes. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Kind of creamy mouthfeel. A bit of warming spices in the finish. Lingering roastiness. A rather well balanced for what it is and not too hard to drink. Spiciness is kept under leash. Tasty and enjoyable.

Bottle. Lots of chocolate and roastiness. Very nice medium to low strenght burning from the chilli and sweet vanilla notes. Medium body, soft carbonation, medium bitter and slightly acidic finish. Very well done stout.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, warka do 14/10/19. prawie czarne, z bardzo ciemna, ladna piana. aromaty intensywnie stoutowe: czekolada, palonosc, kawa, nawet nieco kakao. w tle faktycznie sa jakies nutki mogace pochodzic od tych kosmicznych skladnikow z ktorych polowy nie znam nawet ze slyszenia, niemniej aromat jest rzeklbym normalny. w ustach dopiero czuc poza wszystkim co w aromacie (czekolada nabiera nieco slodyczy, staje sie mleczna), dodatkowo ewidentna, sympatyczna, papryczkowa przyprawowosc. bardzo fajna konsystencja - gesta i gladka zarazem. nisko wysycone. posmaki papryczkowe. klasa piwo (choc po opisie balem sie cudaka)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Tap at Erzbierschof. Ah, a Chili con Cerveza! Pleasantly spicy and hot, lots of chocolate, and very powerful considering the ABV. Beautiful!
Black color with tan head. Espresso aroma, also chocolate. Nearly like an Imperial Stout. Taste is chili, black chocolate, very rich. Espresso finish. Very silky mouthfeel. Excellent for this ABV.

Riecht wie ein Stout, Schokolade und Espresso. Leichte Säure, angenehme bittere hält dagegen. Chilli und Grwürze erst im Leicht trockenen Abgang fühlbar. Not that special. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Mikkeller Barcelona. Black colour with tan head. Roasted, spice, pepper, chocolate aroma. Roasted, chocolate taste, slichtly sweet, with pepper, chili aftertaste. Medium body.

From tap. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, light peppers, coffee, smoke and ashes. Taste is lots of roasted malts, coffee, licorice, smoke and lots of ashes, peppers. Full mouthfeel.
From tap. Pours dark brown with a light brown foam. Aroma is roasted. Chocolate, peppers and citrus. Taste is excellent! Pepper, chocolate, coffee, citrus. The whole thing. Marvelous!

Bottle at Örebro Ölcafe: Aroma of slight roasted malts, chocolate and chili. Taste is mid-sweet with a malty base that carries a nutty bitterness, the the chili kicks in and makes it semi-hot and spicey. It never turns really hot though, so its an enjoyable, spicey brew with a nice balance.

Versa nel bicchiere di color nero impenetrabile, sormontata da una schiuma maestosa, marrone scuro, compatta, cremosa ed elegantemente persistente. Gli aromi di questa Porter sono decisamente belli. Sottili note di cacao in polvere, conferiscono una dolcezza debole ma rotonda. Alcune gradevolissime complessità, sono aggiunte da nocciola, note speziate, un debole colpo di vaniglia ed un fruttato molto sobrio. In bocca note di cioccolato fondente, che forma un mix giocoso con il latte di mandorla aggiuntivo. Questa dolcezza lattea, cede il passo a sentori di caffè amaro ed un leggero condimento a base di erbe. Culmina con un finale molto secco ed un leggero riscladamento, portato dallaggiunta di peperoncino (Cascabel, de Arbol, Guajilo, Mulato e Pasilla); la speziatura aiuta ad abbattere la dolcezza del lattosio e contribuisce al perfezionamento del profilo aromatico.
On tap at mikkeller sf. Pours dark brown. Tan head. Scent is malty. Taste is hoppy. Tasty.

Nera e oleosa con sentori di cacao, malto, frutta secca, lievito, pane, farina... Al palato è rotonda, di corpo medio, quasi "sabbiosa" con note vegetali dolciastre e pungenti allo stesso tempo. Curiosa e soddisfacente.
This is what you can, you should and you will expect from vegetable beer. Its really nice, chocolate porter with some crazy additions. One of the best Ive ever drunk.

Cacao et notes végétales agréables, chili et malts rôtis. Très agréable nez. Goût qui va dans le même sens. Un mélange audacieux et réussi, chocolaté, rôti, épicé, terreux, herbacé avec une touche de tabac, peut-être. Corps richement huileux, bonne effervescence. Finale un peu chaude et amère. Facile à boire, étonnante.

Bottle - 330ml. Perfectly opaque, black body with a thick, lasting, brown foamy head. Fantastic, rich malty/hoppy aroma with chocolate, roasty, and peppery hints. Its robust malty/hoppy taste carries peppery, roasted coffee, and woody notes. Ends with a robust roasty/spicy finish. Very good stuff.

Bouteille 20/05/19. Un liquide brun foncé avec une mousse collante. Un nez de chocolat, chili. La bouche est simple, piquante par le CO2, agréable, de corps moyen, chili, chocolat. Tout un mélange dherbe, de farine de maïs et de chili, même de lepazote, herbe du mythique Pozole. Très bon. Trop peut être aussi bon.

Pours a black brew with a big brown head with good retention, aroma is moderate sweet and moderate bitter with chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla , cinammon, spices and hints of dark fruits, medium to heavy bodied, smooth, flavor is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter, complex and very tasty

Superb.

Super dense aromas, head that lasts for minutes leaving giant laces behind, mouthfeel is creamy yet dry and dense, finish is complex as well as the palate. Well done. Did I say its only 6.6%?

330 ml bottle from The Local Pub, Athens Greece. Pours a black body with a big light brown head. Aromas of chocolate, peppers, roasted notes. Taste is really strange, with almond, chocolate, some pepper oil but not heat, herbal and floral notes. Medium body with low to medium carbonation.

Bottle. Pours opaque black, medium creamy tan head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is rich and roasty, chili peppers, lactose, cocoa. Flavor is light plus sweet, medium bitter, rich with chili flavor, but not much spice. Medium plus body, creamy mouthfeel.
Black very tasty beer. Has a huge chocolate taste. Every sip gives you are a different flavor. Complex and quite nice. Will drink again.

Pitch black with creamy brown froth. Aroma has dark chocolate, cocoa and vanilla. Chocolate and coffee flavour, chili and vanilla. Chili vanilli... haha. Light mouthfeel but pretty flavourful for the ABV. Good spiced porter.
Pours a motor oil black with a oily brown head. Aromas of chilis, coffee, and some chocolate. Astringent chocolate and coffee flavor, not much chili.

Bottle. Black body with brown fast disappearing head. Aroma is spices cocoa vanilla hints of dried fruits and ash. Taste is dark chocolate with roasted malts and some spices and chilli. Aftertaste is roasted malts bitterness with chilli and spices. Nice but I still dont like chilli in beer.

Very complex aroma with bread, burnt coffee and chocolate. Black color, with very minimal brown head. Taste has light sweetness, lightly bitter but not really spicy. Full body, thick feel, fizzy, long finish. I was hoping more spicyness so more chili please. This beer was not bad but I was hoping a bit more. Probably need to revisit this review later after second bottle.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (30A). Bottle 33 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: strong cocoa aroma with slight spicy chili notes and very faint smoky notes. APPEARANCE: very dark brown to black color and opaque. average Brown head with average retention. TASTE: strong roasted flavour with notes of unsweetened cocoa with a very faint spicy hot felling and very faint vegetable flavour from chilis and avocado leaves. medium bitterness from roasted ingredients and not from hops with a dry finish. PALATE: medium-high body with medium-low carbonation. OVERALL: a stout-like beer with a lot of ingredients that are imparted by a strong rosted cocoa flavour.

Wow, strange beer. So yes a lot of stuff going on from all the extras - though its hard to really discern the contributions of black beans, almond mild and avocado leaves- perhaps a sense of not knowing what to look for. But the more familiar cocoa and chili were definitely noticeable. At first I wanted to compare this to CCB Hunahpu, and it many ways it is comparable, big thick black and chewy with a chili-chocolate tone in the finish. But I noted it lacked the rich fullness of Hunahpu, then I realized it is only a 6.6% stout/porter, so of course. Then I was impressed to realize how much body and complexity they packed into such a moderately malted beer. But in the big picture, its hard for me to call it a total success. The rich sweetness of Hunahpu helps balance out the herbals and botanicals but here, those elements create an almost astringent and herbal bitterness that detracts from the total drinkability. Poured opaque black with a big creamy mousse of a brown head

Pours an extremely dark brown with a lot of a reddish brown-taupe head. Coffee, oatmeal, dark chocolate, and green olive on the nose. Viscous and a little powdery on the palate. Mildly sweet up front, but gets remarkably dry 2/3 of the way through. Certainly note the cocoa. The chili notes come through but less prominently. A brief fruitiness followed by a non-offensive vegetal quality. All surrounded by a smokiness.
(750ml bottle) Pours an oily black body with a medium brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, cocoa, caramel, chilies, and spices. Flavor of cocoa, chilies, spices, and roasted malt.
Bottle at the park. Pours black with brown head. Aroma of, licorice, pepper, green, cacoa. Taste cocoa, licorice, green, bitter, chili, brown sugar, milk. Bitter.

Aroma of smoked malts and coffee, poirs a great looking ebony color with a lasting tan well laced head. Amazing taste of coffee, smoke, chocolate with hints of chillies. Creamy medium body with a lasting smokey finish.

Poured from a tap. Dark brown color, full frothy tan head. Cocoa and chili aroma. Full body with a chili and pepper malt flavor and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Big roast, some chocolate, a hint of chile and a little almond. Black pour with good head and lacing. Light bitter finish. Great balance. Thick consistency. Tap at Maxs.
Pours opaque black with a brown head, aroma of chocolate, honey, coffee, greenness, flavor of chocolate, cocoa, red pepper, green, medium bodied

Black color with a nice tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, roasted mat and pepper. Flavor is roasted, notes of chocolate and coffee, slightly pepper again. Low carbonation and medium to full body with a sweet spicy finish.

Bottle @ Mbargo Hornstulll. Black with a creamy long lastning mocha head, leaving lots of lacing. Aroma of Brown suger, cocoa, chili, herbs. Medium bodied with a smooth and spicey mouthfeel. Taste got cocoa, coffee, chili, cream. Nice spicey porter in My book.

Bottled:When I read about all the different ingredients it contained I expected a mess of flavors. But instead I got a soft and well-balanced Porter with a long, dry, roasted finish. Maybe even a little chilli heat at the end. Good!

Really solid looks, large tasty foam. Not quite the bizarre beer I was afraid of. A good thing. It?s a nice stout. Chocolate and roasted aromas, bit on the rough edge, but just because it has no brown sugar or filtered characters, which is a good thing. Enjoyable beer. Perhaps not super complex in the taste and very bitter, but I don?t mind. And for the abv it has a great body! (33cl bottle from Saveur Bière)

Pretty interesting stuff. Strong roasted malt and spice and other earthy aromas. Dark chocolate with a brown foamy head. Thick and weighty palate and smooth. Flavors are complex and blended well. Toasted malt, chocolate, coffee, spice and bean. Really good and herbal.
Thick black. Coffee and chocolate aroma. Taste is a mocha, coffee, some grassy hops and a long lasting bitterness. Cant taste any of that crazy shit they say is in here but it is a fine beer indeed
botella. @El Cabanón, Avilés 17/07/2015, color negro, espuma beige, aroma chocolate, torrefacto, café, sabor chocolate, especias, final seco, cuerpo denso.

Alors bon donc ... euh ... le style "Spice/Herb/Vegetable" je découvre ... Ici, la liste des ingrédients fait peur ! le résultat donne une sorte de stout crémeuse avec des arômes disparates balancé par une amertume un peu bancale. Mousse exubérante ! Le piment réveille tout ça ... On est pas vraiment dans le café. Il y a bien des notes torréfiés de noix .... Cest surprenant , ça part un peu en vrille mais au final jai plutôt apprécié le truc sans trop savoir ce qui se passait. Un peu comme lorsquon goûte pour la première fois un plat élaboré dune cuisine étrangère ...

Bottle to pint glass
Cocoa, milk, coffee, and chili aromas. Pours a dark black with a thin, dark tan mottled head with moderate retention. Taste is coffee, molasses, soy, bread, then changing to a sourness and ending with roast wood and grassy bitterness. Much later, as the bitterness recedes a nice warmness arises in the mouth. I cant say that the almond milk, beans and avocado leaves make much of an appearance, but it doesnt really matter much as this is quite good.
Bottle. Pitch black pour with a fairly dark tan head. Loads of roast, coffee, light heat, chillies, green peppers, toasty nuts. Ok!
Maybe I got a duff bottle but this was as gross as licking a dogs nuts. Deeply astringent with more than a touch of Baby Bio about it.

Aroma is mocha, vanilla bean, espresso, chocolate and almond. Deep rich malts to boot. Taste is again rich and complex malts complete with caramel and chocolate. A light hop presence here that is well balanced and fitting. Appearance is black with a dark brown head that retains very well. Great beer.

Bottle, 330 ml from Svijet Piva, Zagreb. Pours dark brown with lasting brown head. Chocolate aroma. Roasted malts, chocolate, beans, bitter finish with hint of chilli. Complex, medium to full bodied. Looking at the ingredients list I was a bit sceptic but turns out its interesting and successful experiment.
330ml bottle from BrewDog, Liverpool. Deep very black colour with a deep tan head. Aroma is coffee, and chocolate. The taste is sweet and smoky. Nice.

Spice/herb et autres fumures avec  accrochez-vous solidement  du lait damandes, du cacao, du chili (5 sortes différentes!!!), des fèves noires et des feuilles davocat !!!
Avec tout cela 5 malts et 3 houblons... On croit rêver !
Étiquette au design plus que dérisoire.
Couleur noir intense, dune opacité complète.
Mousse brun tournant à la rouille (???), épaisse et crémeuse.
Arômes de feuilles mortes écrasées, cire de meuble, cuir tanné, piment vert, carton mouillé.
1ère bouche veloutée sur un mélange étrange de piments et feuilles de betterave.
Arrière-bouche sans aucune tenue, ni équilibre, mais bien maltée.
2ème où le piment passe en avant, avec le chili (pardon les chilis, voire les hot chili peppers )
Arrière-bouche tout à fait déséquilibrée (on le serait pour moins !!).
3ème mieux intégrée avec du malt chocolat et brun.
Arrière-bouche longue, correcte.
Longueur qui dément immédiatement la 3ème bouche, avec une fumée légère, du piment, des feuilles dacacia, et des épices.
Jambes assez collantes.
Levure très médiocre.
Alcool correct, mais il ne sait où donner de la tête  il y a trop de choses disparates.
Finale qui part complètement en carafe.
CONCLUSION : quelle débauche dingrédients pour un résultat plus que chaotique !!!
Vraiment pas une bière de référence  et une surcote incroyable !!!

Bottle from Toft Vin, Copenhagen - pours black with a brown head. Aroma and taste is a mix of dark roasted malts, chocolate, with some peppery and chilli running through it, some other spices and herbal notes, interesting brew.

Draft to taster. Looks good; a slightly translucent dull black with foamy beige head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells solid; dark malt, mild roast and chocolate, and mild spices (both heat and non). Tastes Iike it smells, but less balanced. Little to no chocolate, and way more bitter. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied and bitter. Overpriced and underwhelming.

Bottle. Pitch-black and thick. No light has a chance of getting through. One finger of some of the darkest foam Ive ever seen sticks around for the whole night. Molasses, dark chocolate and a slight tang lead the aroma, followed by sweet almond and chocolate, plus a touch of anise. Up front in the flavor: spicy chocolate. Chili, dark chocolate, licorice, some spicy heat. The swallow brings nothing but black beans, the chalky mild flavor you find in Mexican dishes. A touch of green flavor Im attributing to the avocado leaves is noticeable as well. Creamy, almost oily body. It takes over the mouth. Lot of spice on the tongue. Awesome beer. Lots going on. Light in alcohol but heavy in flavor.

Bottle. Heavy malt aromas of toasted, molasses and dark chocolate, heavy resin for the hops, moderate earth and dried leaves for the yeast, with background notes of soy sauce and vanilla. Head is small, creamy with bigger bubbles, brown with spotty lacing and good legs, and is mostly diminishing. Color is very dark brown. Flavor starts lightly to moderately sweet, moderately acidic and sour, then finishes moderately acidic and moderately to heavily bitter. Palate is full, creamy, with a lively carbonation and has a sticky finish. The thickest of aromas with the thickest of flavors and feel in the this Multi-spiced Beer.

Bottle at home. Pours bitch black with coffee colored foam. Aroma is filled with spices and roasted nuts. Taste is like a very dark bread with hints of chili and other spices. Overall enjoyable and different and rather heavy.
Bottle at home. Pours black, aroma of chocolate, chili, not as hot as the Texas, light spices.

Bottle from the Rake. It pours jet black with a thick dark tan head. The nose is rich roast, creamy, bitter-sweet, burnt toast, chilli spice, light vegetable notes, tobacco, toffee and burrito action. The taste is smooth, bitter, rich roast, dark chocolate cake, liquorice, umami, light chilli spice, charred wood, earth, burnt toffee and mild acidity with a slick, roasty finish. Just a bit of lingering chilli spice. Big spicy black bean character. Fulsome body, moderate carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Good fun and well balanced (especially considering crazy ingredients).
A very potent dark beer. The dark bitterness is well balanced with a watery sweetness

Pours a nice black with mocha head. Aromas of spice, dark chocolate, earthy black beans, and vegetation.. Lactose too. Nice creamy flavors. Roasted malts, chocolate, cream, avocado. This really works well.

Thanks again cards04. Youve been providing me with a bount lately. Dark body brown foamy head. Very attractive. Grassy almost broccoli aroma. A touch of the pepper in the aroma and some milk. Taste is dark roasty malts. The taste is more typical stout than the aroma. Nice.

Bottle. Pours in black body with medium tan head that is low pretty quickly within a minute. Aroma is roasty, chocolaty, light spicy. Taste has high caramel sweetness, roastiness, vegetable peppers, coffee, medium to high roasty bitterness. Body is full, medium carbonation, heavy.

Nicht gerade das, was man schlecht nennen würde. Recht süffig mit einer schönen schokoladigen Grundform, ein wenig Kaffee und etwas netter Würze zum Schluss. Nicht gerade scharf, aber stellenweise prickelnd und recht belebend.

Bottle from Desverger - many thanks! The beer had got a deep black colour with a steady head and medium body. Aroma of dark chocolate, malt and spiced. Wonderful taste of dark chocolate, pink pepper, grounded coffee, malt, woods and light exotic spices. Very smooth to drink, highly quaffable and enjoyable. Loved it.
Pitch black color, average sized brown head with good retention. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, herbs, spices.

750 ml bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Black with 3 fingers of tan head. Aromas of big roasty notes, bitter chocolate, burnt nuts, some floral notes. Tastes of dark chocolate, bitter roasty notes, cocoa, creamy milk. Medium-full body with a semi-dry finish.

Pours dark brown with a very fine tan head. Nose is chocolate, dark, rich chilies, dates, subtle tobacco. Flavor is lots of dark chocolate verging on red berries, cocoa, espresso, maple syrup, subtle spicy chili. Theres sort of an unctuous nutty note that I feel may come from the avocado leaves. Finish is the chili without the heat, a little black pepper, subtle sweetness and a little smoke. Very rich, velvety and viscous mouthfeel. Feels more like a 10% beer in terms of mouthfeel, but without any hot alcohol notes. Really great as always.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Stass place. Thanks Stas & Vova. Black with tan head. Lots of coffee, red berries and vanilla as well as mild chili aroma. Spicy chili, lots of roast, cocoa and fruit taste. Full body, dry and roasted finish.

Bottle sample at a tasting . Thanks Stas & Vova. Deep brown black with a stable tan head. Smell of roasted malt, coffee beans, chocolate, herbs. Taste - sweet, roasted grains, chilli, cocoa, coffee, dark chocolate, mild bitter finish. Med full bodied, smooth and creamy. Good.
Bottle at home. Pours black color, dark beige head. Aroma of coffee, vanilla, chilli, spicy. Taste medium bitter, medium sweet, coffee, vanilla, chilli, cocoa, roasted malt.

330 ml bottle at bar Holy Moly, Göteborg. Pours black with tanned head. Smell is roasted malt, coffee and a lot of chocolate. Taste is roasted malt with coffee, chocolate and some mild chili and complex fruitiness. Heavy complex body. Dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Stass place. Thanks Stas & Vova. Black with a tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, cocoa and some vegetal chili peppers. Roasty flavor with coffee, chocolate and mild chili. Medium to full-bodied. Good, but I cant find most of the adjuncts here.
No idea what purpose all those extras serve, but man is this good. Gooey black pour. Aromas of roast, chocolate, spice. Smooth mouthfeel, balance. Lovely.

This beer is really black. The head seems like a chocolate syrup. Beer smooth like jazz, creamy with full body and low carbonation. I expected more chili but its well balanced and it has a medium bitterness. You can smell out the avokado but I cant find it in the taste. Full of chocolate, bready/roasted/smoked aromas. I can only says WOW.

In short: chocolate spicy beer.
Aroma: light chocolate, nuts, chile.
Appearance: pours black with cream foam.
Taste: light sweet to medium spiced/bitter.
Palate: very drinkable, lasting spicy finish

(330ml bottle from Ølbutikken) Pours black with a big frothy dense medium tan head leaving impressive lacework. Aroma reminds me of mole, with dark chocolate and a smoky, savoury and spicy blend of chilies in the foreground. A nutty refried bean note. A little dark malt sweetness. A bit of fresh herbs. Átlátszatlanul fekete színű testén egy krémes, kakaó barna habpaplan telepszik meg, kissé robusztusabb kinézetet adva a főzetnek, mint amire számítottam. Egy füstölt keretbe ágyazott illatorgiával kell aztán szembesülnünk, melyet a söröktől általában idegen összetevők jelenlétének tudhatunk be. Némi kötözött sonka aromája tűnik fel előttünk, melyhez pirospaprika, telt maláta és enyhe kókuszos-vaníliás vonulat csatlakozik, összességében azonban a chili rendkívül hangulatos jelenléte a meghatározó, melynek imitt-amott felbukkanó, pajkos csípőssége aztán ízében is kimutatható, természetesen nem fékevesztettül égető, inkább játékosan bizsergető formában. Igen érdekes jelenség, amint az édeskésen induló ízvilág egyszerre csak átfordul egy pácléhez hasonló, paprikás chips karakterű, növényes jellegbe. A vaníliás, kókuszos ízhatás számomra kevésbé valósul meg, az avokádóval kapcsolatos ismeretségem pedig meglehetősen szegényes, némi fekete babos hatás azonban határozottan érvényesül. Az eddigiek alapján nyilvánvalóvá válhatott, hogy jelen tesztalanyunk nem az a megszokott "beszélgetős" sör, a hagyományos és jól bevált összetevőkön edződött ízlelőbimbók valószínűleg sírva menekülnek előle, az újszerű hatásoktól kevésbé idegenkedő, kísérletező kedvű fogyasztóknak azonban mindenképpen megéri kipróbálni.

I also think I get some almonds but I cant tell if its just because I know about them or not. Taste is delicious with dark chocolate, cocoa beans, very roasted, coffee notes, alot of spices, liquorice and I also get the chili but not as strong as the Texas Ranger. This is really a treat! Very well brewed!

Black with creamy head. Aroma is grassy and spicy perhaps with some aniseed or clove? Has a thick, rich texture. Flavour has a light chilli warmth and a certain creamy taste perhaps coming from the beans.

Bottled @ de Molen tasting, small sample. Dark brown color, short head. Aroma of roasted malts, some coffee, hint of peppers. Bit bitter in taste, some sweetness, slight spicy kick in the finish. I dont get a lot of most of the ingredients, but at least the peppers arent that dominant either, so the beer itself is pretty much in balance. Decent stuff, though not spectacular. Just tasty.

Bottle at the March 2014 De Molen monthly tasting. Poured a clear dark brown with a frothy tan head and some broken lace. A really tasty beer with the right level of spice and lots of complex flavours.
Bottle @ 2nd Tuesday tasting. Aroma is chili, chocolate, roast, liquorice, coffee, cream. Flavour is quite chocolate, faint chili, almond, roast, liquorice. Nice.

Bottle at monthly 2nd Tuesday tasting at De Molen, hosted by dEnk. Black pour, thick tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, quite spicy, chilies, black beans, molasses and some licorice. Flavor is very spicy, quite strange, bitter but still remarkably smooth. Not too sharp. Strangely likable.

Sample at the Molen monthly tasting.
thick creamy tan head. Clear black pour. Some chocolate. A little spicy.

Pours pitch black with a low mocha head. Aroma is espresso, dark chocolate, brown sugar, honey, chilis, vanilla. Taste is dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, brown sugar, honey. Mouthfeel is creamy and sticky with almost no carbonation. Aftertaste is chocolate, coffee and slight chili.

Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of chili, whisky barrel, dark chocolate, roasted malts. Taste is chocolate and chili, loads of chocolate as it were. Light to medium creamy body.

0.33l bottle. Pours like oil, pitch black and thick. The head is brown and lasts long. Aroma of chocolate, cocoa, grass, star anis and mandarin. The taste is very smooth. It has a nice chocolate base on top of which there is some cocoa, smoke, grass and citrusy hops. Wow! This is an awesome beer.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2014 ----- Botella de 33 cl de el lúpulo tomada en el momento en Belmonte el 21-11-2014.  Con fecha de cons pref para antes de 24-10-2016. color negro intenso con espuma bastante oscura. Aromas de maltas tostadas y quemadas con bastantes toques herbáceos frescos junto con cacaos, especias y pimientas. Cuerpo medio, algo denso y pastoso. Sabores intensos de maltas tostadas ligeramente quemadas seguido de herbáceas frescos junto con algo de cacao, café y toques terrosos de pimientas y chile. Final ligeramente amargo bien combinado con todo lo anterior y que permanece por un buen rato. Bastante buena, tal vez falta de algo mas de picante. Para repetir y repetir.
----- Botella de 33 cl en el lúpulo tomada varias veces durante junio, julio de 2013. Multitud de sabores y aromas herbáceos combinados con maltas tostadas todo ello bastante intenso y perfectamente combinado. Color negro intenso y cuerpo medio con 6.6 vol. Todo una autentica combinación de especias, maltas, chiles y otros ingredientes genial. Tal vez podía ser un poco mas picante (a pesar de que lleva cinco tipos de chile). Para repetir sin duda.

color negro prácticamente opaco con densa y duradera espuma beige oscuro. Aromas de vainilla, especias y tostados. En boca es densa, el inicio es tostado y sedoso, para después pasar a un amargor seco y especiado que va dejando algo de picante en el regusto. Muy rica.

Kind of scary with all the ingredients listed on the bottle but it worked for me. The almond milk and cocoa is what I mostly tasted and even though I am not a fan of milk stouts I like this. I think the cocoa and spices rounds out the lactose that usually turns me away from milk stouts.
Crazy beer from mikkeller , more like a Mexican soup than what many would recognise as beer. Fantastic chipotle aroma, with a spicy stout flavour .
Bottle - Dark chocolate, chilli and roasted peppers. Jet back with a rich brown head. Chocolate, cocoa, hop bitterness and spices. Most of the flavours are lost for me.

Conviene decisemente passare il confine con Mikkeller, da Texas a Mexas il gusto ci guadagna! Birra dal colore scurissimo e un cappello persistente di schiuma marroncina. Il carattere, già dallaroma, risulta molto complesso. Intensa cioccolata, malti tostati, una sfumatura citrica che testimonia il passaggio di luppoli, che però risulta soverchiata dalla componente choco e da quella chili, responsabile di unintrigante speziatura, che senza mai sfociare esplicitamente nel piccante, irretisce la lingua lasciando una sensazione piacevolissima, conclusa con un tocco di amaro nel finale. Sensazionale!
Flaska @ Mikkeller Bar 8/2-2014. Kaffe/kaffebönor, rostade toner, chili, kryddor, torr, len. Lång torr avslutning.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2014 Appearance: Very dark brown, basically black. Nice amount of creamy, dark tan head.
Aroma: Dark malt, dark chocolate. Slight spices, almonds. Some sweetness.
Taste: Lots of dark malt, chocolate. Roasted, burnt, even smoke. Spices/Chilies.
Info: 330ml bottle, 12/2-2014, 46/300M, BB: 24/10-2016

Bottle 330ml. I was expecting something strange, like "one of those weird beers" but to be honest, this beer is fantastic. The beer is very dark, with big pale brown head. In aroma I can smell a hit of rosted malts, some chocolate, coffe, citrus notes from hops and something that came probably from the chili peppers. In taste its very complex - like it was light imperial stour, not some dark ale with spices. The chili flavour is rather mild and its not dominating the beer, there is a well ballanced sweetness and bitterness. Absolutely great beer, I wasnt expecting that it will be so good!

Bottle @ Oluthuone Kaisla, August 2013. RB-rating #700
Delicious aroma is roasted, has vanilla, chili and coconut. A bit spicy flavour has roasted malts, coffee, chocolate and coconut. Suprisingly tasty beer, not very chili hot though, its somewhere in the background.

Black, with brown towards ref thick foam. Mildly sour fruit blended with roasted coffee tones in the aroma. Malt, mild fruits, alcohol, chockolate with roasted mildly bitter aftertaste of coffee, mild chili burn.

Csak a jó sör, Budapest.

 Fekete, mint a szurok és egy igen vastag, világosbarna habot termel a kiöntésnél, ami keményen tartja magát. Illata igen fűszeres, szivaros, földes, kakaós és érdekesen konyhás. :) Ízében is ott egy csomó dohány, pörkölt fa, szurokfű, füstölt csili paprika, fekete csoki, gyógynövénylikőr, keserű mandula, sok komlógyanta és még a fekete babot is sejteni lehet benne. Sűrű, testes anyag, nem túl szénsavas. Utóíze keserű, ragadós, gyantás és kormos, nagyon száraz. Hú, ez nagyon fura, kis ráhangolódás után viszont igen szórakoztató.

black colour, huge, dense creamy dark brown head - just like a hot chocolate; aroma of dark chocolate, roastedness,and hints of citrus; taste of roasted coffe, dark chocolate, citrussy background and spicy aftertaste; really good porter...due to the selected hops, slightly similar to a black IPA.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2015 A blind grab and what a winner I found! This is not your everyday brew. Dark as hell pour and equally black and tan swirl head. Beautiful aroma. Like a fresh vegetable garden having sex with toasted malts. Surprisingly spicy, but cool and refreshing like a creamy stout. Complex as hell because you can still taste those hops back there as well. This is a must try!
Noire. Mousse moka. Bien amère. Chocolat. Café corsé. Sucré. Bien aromatique. Florale. Légèrement végétale. Originale. Belle expérience.
Monipuolinen, chilin maku tulee viiveellä. Pitkä ja miellyttävä jälkimaku, hieman kahvinen. Ulkomuodoltaan varsin tumma, vaahto paksua ja kermaista. Tuoksussa myös kahvia.

Bottle pours a very dark brown with a dark tan head, decent lacing. The aroma is very strong, the barrel is noticeable. I also get the almond milk, and chilies. The taste is also strong; chilies, chocolate, creamy-ness of milk with the bitter finish of black beans. Overall quite enjoyable.
Bottle from MJRBC, velvety brown color with some thin foam, aroma is chocolate and oily burnt wood, flavor of burnt wood, dark chocolate, peppery oily body with bitter finish

Black beer with a huge creamy head. Aroma is chocolaty, later smokey. Medium full mouthfeel, chocolate dominates. Turns into bitter smokiness afterwards. Missing some aspects the ingredients say and also the chocolate is a bit too much. Decent, was expecting something a bit more.

Black beer with brown head leaving lacing. Chocolaty sweet aroma. Drier chocolate flavor. Medium full. Little carbonation. Pretty long and sour finish. Weird, the spices don't come through.

Bottle at Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade, july 17th 2013. Black body, big brown fading head. Aroma of dark chocolate, roasted malt, licorice. Taste is spicy, pretty hot, sweet and full body, with chili peppers, espresso, hints of bacon, considering all the unusual ingredients I find it very well balanced with a smooth palate, cocoa and chili aftertaste. A very interesting brew!
Bottle at kaisla, helsinki. Black color, nice brown head. Aroma is spicy and roasty malts, chocolate, coffee. Balanced roasty body, some chilis burning, coffee, chocolate.

750 ml bottle. Pours pitch black with a big, thick, tan head the fades slowly and leaves nice webbing. Love the aroma. Cocoa, chocolate cake, espresso, ash, chilies, black beans, licorice, and some spiciness that I cant quite identify. Taste is a very odd mix of flavors but I still really like it. Strong ashy flavor at first but then the sweet chocolate and espresso mellow it out. Bitter coffee finish with some wood, black beans and licorice. Very light chili spiciness too. Thick body, foams up a little giving a very full mouthfeel, coating everything. Love this beer. I would buy it often if the price were a bit lower.

Appearance: near black, with a dense, creamy dark tan head you could float a quarter on and that lasts forever, leaving silky curtains of tight-bubbled lacing. Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours black with a lasting and lacing light brown creamy medium head. On tap at Mikkeller Bar, CPH North. Fresh and lively cocoa and cognac on the nose, pours a thin black with caramel head. Hints of spicy to augment bottom of smoke, beans and light hop. Fleeting finish, with some complexity.

Bottle enjoyed at home with family and tacos. Pours nearly black with thick, dense, creamy mocha head that sticks around and leaves all kinds of lacing. Aroma is mostly cocoa, roasty, with a bit of pepper. Taste - surprisingly dry, unsweetened cocoa and a nice bit of chili spice at the back of the throat. A unique beer (an elaboration on a chili-spiced stout i guess) that really comes together.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a lager glass. Pours coal black with big fluffy medium brown head. Aroma is dry chocolate, medium body, medium carbonation, and very little lacing. Taste is dry, dark cocoa, some peppers, and spices. Irish stout with spices, not my thing.

Draft at el bait shop. Pours black with a thin khaki head. Leaves a lotmof lacing in the glass. A bit of chili pepper on the nose. Has some spices on the tongue but theyre faint. Finishes clean. Ive been wanting to try this for months and it didnt do much for me.

Bottle at home. Pours dark brown to black in color with a medium sized tan head. The aroma has roasted malts, chocolate, spices, a splash of vanilla and some berry like fruit. Chill your beans. Imagine a story set in the Lone Star State, a Texas Manger if you will. A future President born to promote harsh criminal punishment and an advocate of the death penalty. Bottle. Pours a very dark, almost black beer with a nice, creamy tanned head on top with beautiful lacing on the glass. Aroma is malty, chocolate, vanilla and some nutty influences. Bottle @ benzai thx to joes. Pitch black with a small light brown head. Smells sweet, roasty, coffee, chocolate.. Great smell! Tastes peppery, roasty, chocolate.. Pretty deep and nice taste. Not burning or anything. Medium to full body, nice carbo. Good beer.

Bottle, 375ml - Opaque dark brown beer with a large brown head. Aroma is spicy with notes of chocolate, chili, citrus and roasted cereal. Flavor is spicy with notes of chocolate, chili, citrus, beans, roasted barley and chipotle. Wow, amazing beer. Truly amazing.

Milky smooth palate, creamy. Bottle. Nice dark pour with a light brown head that dissipated fairly quickly. Aroma is complex with spices and some woody characteristics. Has a very nice, creamy mouthfeel with a dry finish. I didnt get anything from the avocado leaves, but it had a nice slight spiciness that complemented the bitter dark chocolate. Bottle. Pours an extremely dark brown color with a moderate light brown head on it. Nose is extremely complex and interesting - I get some mole in there as well as chilis coming through; I would happily eat this beer if it came as a burrito. Taste has a little bit of bitter chocolate to it with some definite smokey chili tones coming off it. Really interesting...

A steady pour into my teku glass produces a three-finger thick, richly browned head that leaves some light, multi-layered lacing on the sides of my glass. The beer is a black color that is quite opaque when held up to the light. The aroma has a vanilla like scent to it up front and a chocolate character that then has a richly roasted malt character, a spicy / herbal note that is quite unique, and a toasted nutty and whole grain character.
 
Lightly sweet with lots of roasted character that has a certain bitterness to it. The finish has a bitter herbal note to it as well as a rounded, sort of earthy flavor to it. The beer has a light carbonation to it that works well with the rich, though not heavy, body that lingers a bit on the palate. The beer gets a touch spicy after a couple sips and then is noticeably spicy, though only lightly so, from there on out. Rich dark chocolate notes, roasted nut flavors , ample toasted whole grain brown bread flavors that arent quite burnt, as well as burnt berry like fruit notes.
 
A really nice beer, it is quite rich and tasty, and the chili works quite well here. Far better than the Stout with lots of extra ingredients that I just had, in this case it works quite well, and the beer is rich enough to stand up to the extra ingredients.

Tap at Maxs. Pours nearly opaque black with dark brown highlights and a medium, frothy brown head, short retention with good lacing. Aroma is prunes, figs, dates, chocolate and coffee malt earthy hops and vegetable notes. Flavor is spices, dark bitter malt, medium hops and bitterness, chocolate, faint avocado and a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Black pour with a thick dense mocha head that lasts for quite a while until settling down to a cap. Aroma is cocoa and chiles. Taste is baking cocoa, faint chiles, tobacco, earth, and wood. I did like Texas ranger better, but this is yet again amazing for its low abv.

Draft. Pours opaque black with a thin tan head. Tastes like coffee, bitter, with a dry spice. Light body and medium carbonation. Smells like dry cocoa and light coffee bitterness.

Pours pitch black with a big light brown head that stays. Burnt taste, but I expected more spice.

Bottle. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of spice, some vegetal notes, herbs and herbs with some roasted notes. Flavor is sweet and roasted with some smoked notes, coffee, chocolate , chili with some herbal notes. Medium body, average carbonation.

Thanks to Tim and Rachel, I believe! Black pour with a creamy tan head. Aroma of spicy chili peppers, dark chocolate, roasted malts, hints of smoke and pine. Chocolatey, smokey, roasted malts flavor with spicy peppers and piney finish. Silky mouthfeel and nice balance. Good stuff.

Bouteille 750ml. De couleur brune-noire et opaque. Post-goût long-moyen et un peu sec, légèrement amer de rôti, moyen de chocolat noir, léger de café, légèrement végétal (chili), dépices et de houblon herbeux avec des notes fumées.

Black with a brown head. Aroma: Chocolate, coffee, chili, roasty and malty. Taste: Not as forward with the chocolate, very coffee flavoured, spicy from the chili. Roasty and meaty. Ill probably get this one again.

strong aroma of coffee, chocolate and herbs, black clear liquid and fine solid brown head, medium bitterness, and light sour.  medium to full bodied, creamy texture, and a lively carbonation with a  hot, bitter aftertaste.

I think mikkeller has hit the mark with a lot of the spiced porters. This one is not exception. Nice roast, nice pepper component, a bit thin but its good.

coffee coloured head that disappears quickly. dark clear coffee aroma of liquorice, coffee, chocolate and hop. dense taste (due to avocado and almonds probably), bitter, chocolate and with a stingy sensation on the palate. a bit weird. bottle 33cl / notes from backlog

Bottle from State Line. Pours oily black with thick mocha coffee brown head. Nose and taste of roasted chocolate, chili peppers, almonds, avocado, cocoa, vanilla custard, milk chocolate and light mint leaf. Medium body. Very little pepper heat in the finish.

33cl bottle courtesy of sebletitje. It pours with an awesome looking dark chocolate milk shake head floating on a deep dark body of liquid. Bottle at a ChrisO tasting - London. Pours oily black with a thick, beige foam head. Interesting nose, traditional black thick black chocolate, some roast, plus more exotic notes. Rich chocolate malt aroma with nutty spices. Dark brown colour wonderful head and lacing. Malt chocolate flavour with almonds spices and a hint of chilli. Smooth thick palate.

Why does the label say 11.2 oz when this seems to be a 750?  Dark brown with a sizable brown head that refuses to fade. Thick brown frothy head on a black liquid. Malty and spicy aroma. Taste of chili and some licorice. Pretty smoky aswell.

bomber poured almost black with light brown head. the aroma for me was deep chocolate and some other unknown scents..could have been the chilis not to sure...the flavor was very good. was roasted malts and chocolate with a mild chili pepper end to it...would assume that the almond milk muted the flavor of the chili leaving just traces. but overall a very good beer.

Bottle, unexpectedly shipped  from my fatherthanks so much, dude! Its an 11.2 FL OZ/331 mL bottle containing an inky brown-black combination with an ascending, amazingly fluffy mocha head, 4½. fingers in length which gradually sank to just 1½.. I may have to stand back the aromas are so intensely complex, but what I get almost immediate is: charcoal bricks, chili peppers (it most certainly teases the nostrils), cardamom spiciness (keyword here: "earthy"), chocolate almond milk (ironically, I had bought some recently and the nose is quite reminiscent of that),  Dutched chocolate, tangerine peels (yes, there is indeed some citrus in this bitch, especially on the nose), wheat flour, cinnamon rolls/doughnut  glaze, celery sticks, aluminum (oh, you know what I fuckin mean), Kero syrup, wormwood, anise, avocados (strangely, the avocado comes through in the aroma really strongly; didnt think it would), pancake butter, pomegranates, roasted malts, brown sugar, and limeade. Tastes deliciously well-rounded, bittersweet, roasted, nutty, charred, and leathery with notes of chili pepper heat, almond butter, avocados, bay leaves, dark chocolate, burnt hay, and spent grains. Ends bitter and earthy; hops, spruce tips, white tea and bacon grease by swallow. Transformative! And I was starting to think that Mikkeller didnt brew any beer worth good money. Fantastic fill!

330ml bottle @ Viisi Penniä, Helsinki. Pours black with a brown head. Very hoppy aroma with pepper, coffee and roasted malt. Almost burnt flavour with lots of herbal hops and some coffee. Hoppy finish.

Comme je ne sais pas ce que sent une feuille davocat je ne me prononcera pas sur le bénéfice de cette dernière dans cette bière.
Au final, sympa, à boire encore même si jai été un peu déçu car il y a quand même qcq ingrédients que je nai pas vraiment pu noter.


Une bière qui peut rebuter au premier abord de par sa liste dingrédients atypiques mais qui au final se laisse boire en petite bière de dessert.

Bottle 0.33l from Viisi Penniä, Helsinki. Colour is dark brown with large brownish head. Aromas and flavours coffee, spicy, hops, chocolate and roasted malts.

33cl, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2012, with Mexican spices, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex spicy Porter, roasted/spicy and slightly malty/sweet, not too heavy, very balanced, hazy, rocky head, very good and original brew!, yet expensive

(Bottle, 0.33 l, at Oluttupa Viisi Penniä, 20121214) The beer poured black. Its head was lightly brow and medium sized. Aroma had roasted malts, chilli and smoke.
