Black as night with a beige head. Chilli in the aroma - great! Touches of coffee and chocolate as well. Burrito in a glass! Fantastic beer.

Growler. Black with creamy tan head. Sweet roasted aroma with notes of vanilla, chocolate, a little spicy. Taste is soft with roasted malt, chocolate, spices. Discreet chili in the finish. Very drinkable and interesting tastewise at the same time.

071212. Bottle at Kuktainen Apina, Tampere. Pours black v with a nice head. Aroma spices, roasted malts, vanilla, coffee. Dry feel with only a hint of spices. Medium full bodied. Like a Porter. Not Bad.

Bottle @ Christers. Pours Black with a light brown head. Aroma roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, pepper, light chilly. Flavor of malt, coffee, dark chocolate, light spice, cinnamon, pepper, light chilly. Medium body, oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Body and mouthfeel is quite impressive for the ABV, allthrough the finish is a little short. 041212

Bottle. Almost black with small brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, pepper, little coffee and a little chili. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, chocolate, pepper, little chili, hop, medium sweet and medium bitter.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Black with a lasting dark brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate and chili. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. Oily and smooth. Extremely thick for 6.6 % ABV. 041212
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, chili, vegetables, chocolate and hops. Nice and dry.

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with huge, fluffy tan head. Aroma of earth, smoked chilli, coffee, ash, tobacco, licorice and raw sugar. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of coffee and earth and a light chilli burn. Medium bodied with low to medium carbonation. Quite nice, but I prefer the Texas Ranger.
Sample at ÖÖWF 2012. Dark malty smell with chocolate and chilli. Similar taste with coffee, roasted notes, chocolate and chilli. A bit strong with the coffee and chilli, but besides that nice.
Really nice beer. Love the flavours and complexity. You can pick up the chili and other spices; fantastic beverage.

Bottle at Bar Fred. Exceptional. Aromas of chocolate, caramel, nuts, hints of smoke and alcohol. Taste is sweet and spicy, with light bitterness, and very long length. Palate is velvety, and medium bodied. Black, with a frothy head.

330ml bottle. I didnt expect the thick black sludgy looking beer that poured from the bottle. Lots of cocoa aromas with a mix of spices in there as well. Looks solid in the glass with a thick black colour and a deep brown head that stays around for a while. Unusual flavour with some bitter chocolate, cocoa, pepper and hint of chilli in the back of the mouth. Interesting, unusual and very tasty.

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2012 33cl bottle @ Beer Temple shared with Ronald ("The Dutch Fin"). Opaque pitch black, medium sized brown head. Smell malts, roasted malts, lightly burned malts, lightly spicy but not overpowering at all, very good balance. Taste malts, roasted malts, burned malts, slightly peppers, some other spices but again not overpowering, very balanced. Also coffee, which is present in the aftertaste as well. Probably a lot more you can taste in this one. Very balanced. Very nice beer!

Large frothy tan head mild medium carbonation dark pour aromas spicy note chili scent earthy notes some lovely vapours the flavours gritty taste earthy roasted chocolate goodness fruity sharpness mild but sharp chili taste very spicy paprika peppery taste a fizz decent sweetness the finish good drinking ale malt and hop tastes good roasted earthy spicy fizzy sharp fruity just some of the good names that come up in this ale good sweetness and chili touch nice ale indeed

Good aroma of chili and dark malts. Taste was not what I expected to be honest. Didnt detect much chili, but it was an excellent, subtle dark beer. Prefer the Texas Ranger, but this is still top notch.

Pours black with a large, dark tan head.
Nose shows roasted malt, chocolate, earthy notes and coffee beans.
Similar flavours. Lots of roasted malt, earthy notes, cocoa and an aggressive roasty finish.
Carbonation seems full on.
Botella. color negro y espuma beige poco persistente. Aroma a maltas tostadas y especias ( como restaurante mejicano ). Sabor a chocolate cacao especias y un ligero final seco y picante

UPDATED: APR 11, 2013 Slowbeer (6-Oct-12) Big choc spice, rounded almond roast malt aroma. Thick blackcolour, great complex lacing. Big hop spice herbal choc almond and plum flavour. Great soft rounded sweet roasted malt finish and spicy light smoked malt aftertaste.

From a 330ml bottle on 25 September 2012. Pours black wit a fine, medium to big tan head. Has a strong aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate with a touch of spice. This is a very big beer flavour wise, and comes across as bigger than 6.6%. There is a huge roasted/burnt malt presence, with dark chocolate, sweet milk chocolate, espresso, vanilla, some slight smokey and herbal notes, and a quite subtle yet very distinct warming chilli finish. Satisfyingly bitter for a dark beer, with the carbonation is a little higher than normal. A slightly unusual but very impressive stout. Mikkeller kicks yet another goal.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours thick black with a heavily tanned head which lasts and lasts leaving superb lacing. Nose shows heavy spice - ginger, cacao, basil. A touch of vanilla and mild earthiness with hints of liquorice and chocolate. Taste begins very chocolatey which is slwoly taken over by a gradual spice which gets bigger and bigger in body. Vanilla sweetens things out. Very earthy and grassy on the finish with the smallest amount of chilli heat at the end. The heat comes with a slight bitterness. Creamy mouthfeel. A touch heavy on the finish with very soft carbonation. Very nice stuff

Fad: Kulsort øl med et mokkabrunt skumhoved. Duften er brændt med en tand chili og sukker i duften. Smagen er en tand for klæbrig på denne meget olieret og bitre øl. Chilien kan anes, men kan ikke bringe friskhed til øllen. Ok men langt fra fantastisk.

Bottle at the Beer Temple. Black eith a creamy tan head. Roasted malts nose. In the mouth the spice mix comes to its right, overpowering the roast. Difficult to describe, caramel, chocolate, bitter spices all mingling together. Original at least.

Pours a pitch black beer with a beige head. The aroma is malt, roasted, licorice, coffee and chocolate. The flavor follows the nose with additional weak chili. The palate is sweetness with roasted notes. Overall a good beer.

very dark brown color. Chocolate cake,  chili, careml, cardom in nose. The mouth is med body, slightly spicy, chocolate cake, bay leaves and a bit of cardomon. Fairly malty. Great nose, but mouth is good but not the same depth. Still excellent.

On tap at Beer Temple. Black, beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, cocoa, milk chocolate, light spice. Flavour is medium sweet, milk chocolate, roasted malts, light chili, cocoa, light bitter chocolate and roast finish, hint of spice. Maybe served a bit too cold, but I found this to be quite muted for a spice beer. Light to medium-bodied.

Bottle, bought @ Mikkeller Bar, Cph.
Pours completely black with a firm, staying, creamy, beige head. Splendid duration. Aroma has fat chocolate, mild chili burn, roasted malts, herbal notes on top and a touch of coffee. Medium carbonation, fat and super-creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has roasted malts, herbal notes, soft yet firm chili burn. Lingering coffee bitterness with a good hops balance. When you consider the ingredients, this is very well balanced. Lovely.

Tap @ Beer Temple. Black color. Head is dark, brown, uneven, with good lace. Aromas: roasted malts, herbal (hard to identify), milk chocolate, hint of sour fruit & licorice/drop. Flavor is medium sweet, roasted, herbal. Medium bodied. Only slightly spicy feel in the throat. Finishes even more roasted, ashy, then dry & bitter

Bottle 330ml.Clear dark brown black colour with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, off-white to beige head. Aroma is light heavy malty, roasted, cacao, chocolate, spicy, chiili, herbs, dusty. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120506]

33cl bottle from ølbutikken.
pitch dark, smooth brown head.
Very nice hoppy and coffee roasted aroma, mild chili aroma too, slightly herbal the good way. supernice dry imp stoutish aroma.
flavor is roasted malts, cocoa, chilies, good burn, cofee powder, faint charchoal flavor that grows towards the end, flavor profile somewhat reminds me of yeti imp. stout, but a little chili in there too. Probably the best beer in the ratebeer spice/herb/vegetable ive ever tasted.
Pours dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, green pepper, chocolate and liquorish. Flavour is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, liquorish, light green pepper and light chili.

330ml bottle. Chocholate, spices aromas. Pours very dark, with a really nice creamy tan head, frothy, really persistent, good lacing.Body is medium to full, average carbonation, oily texture. Taste is some roasty, spicy, caramel and chocolate. Long spicy finish. Interesting one.
Extremely complex both in taste and smell, it is actually possible to taste the added chili beans to this beer.

Draught. Low fluffy white lasting head. Pitch black body. Choccolate coffee vanilla aroma. Complex spicy flavor with choccolate at the front with a mild smoky hint and and a nice long bitter ending. Low carbonation.

In bottle. Pours a very dark brown colour with a tan head. Aroma is reminiscent of a burrito with spicy black beans, almond, cocoa, chilli, roasted peppers and alcohol. Similar flavours with smoky chipotle peppers, dark chocolate and maybe a little mescal also. Moderate carbonation and an oily mouth-feel. Excellent!

bottle at home ... thanks ben ... deep black ... thin tan head ... light cola .. big spice ... little star anise ..chopolte pepper .. biggest on the nose is the spicy pepper ... light spice up front ... foams quite a bit in then ... soft chocolate roast ... very tobacco leaf ... can you avacado leaves? ... soft lightest smoke from the chilli
Bottle. Black with a big brown head. Strange aroma, lots of spices, smokey,  peppers. Similar taste, some chocolate in there, lots if smoke and spices and peppers. Very fizzy. Nice

Bottle. Pours a black color with a longlasting tan head. Has a roadyed malty spicy chocolate aroma with hints of chili. Roasted malty dry spicy bitter chocolate flavor with hints of chili. Has a roasted malty spicy chili chocolate finish with bitter aftertaste.

Bottle at Mikkeller Bar, May 2012.

Black with a nice looking, large brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, nuts, chili and dark chocolate. The same in the taste, also spices and more chili. An interesting beer that was balanced in a strange way.

Mikkeller bar, maj 2012: Kladdig, het chili i eftersmaken, torr, lätt rostig med en bärig ton lite bak.
Notes de cacau, vainilla i tabac. El picant quasi bé no es nota. Está bona però magrada més la Texas.

Bottle. Pours black with a glorious bronze head. Thick and it leaves stick lacing down the edge of the glass. Aroma is superb with coffee, chocolate and Vicks Vapo-rub. Tastes like a really good porter but with more going on. Spiced and spicy. The chilli flavour is delicious with only a little heat. Bitter coffee finish and then the chillies come out to play for the aftertaste. Everything is put together sparingly to great effect. Absolutely delicious.

330 ml bottle.
Pours a pitch black colour with a beautiful brown head. Very rich aroma of roasted malts, nuts and black beans. Flavour of roasted malts, nuts, dark chocolate, strong spices and leather. No chili burn here. Full bodied, thick mouthfeel and a long, roasty and spicy finish. Very well balanced.

33 cl bottle @ hotel room, copenhagen
Aroma is rather roasted with vanilla and cocoa. Very smooth palate. Flavour is slightly spicy and rather roasted with coffee, some dark chocolate and cocoa. The chili is hard to observe, just some spices in the flavour and aftertaste. A feeling of an imperial stout with this ABV  wow.

330ml bottle from Kihoskh

Pours pitch black with a nice smooth brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, beans, spices, chocolate, licorice and some chili. Taste is complex, spicy and roasty with a lot of cocoa, beans and some chili notes. Finish is warming, spicy and roasty. Nice, tasty spiced ale.

33 cl bottle @ hotel room in Copenhagen.
Pours pitch black color with a large beige head. Aroma of toasted malt, chocolate, mild mocha and cocoa, spices and some fruit notes. Flavor of spices, toasted malts, chocolate, hints of cocoa and mild fruits. Chili isnt that noticeable but quite good still.
3426

From tap @Mikkeller. A dense light brown choco head, upon a entirely black body. Heavily roasted dark malts and wide range of nice-smelling spices to the nose. Feels full in the mouth. Again, the roasted dark malts blends perfectly with the spices added. The chili is noticable, leaving a nice little burn on the tongue. Balancing bitterness underneath. Spices linger in a long finish. Spice-o-rama!

Spice-o rama.
Bottled. More or less pitch black colour with a medium brown head. Aroma is chocolate, chili, mild herbal notes as well. Flavour is quite pleasant and some slight chili notes.

Bottled. Pitch Black coloured. Light Brown  dense head. Roast, Brown sugar, Cocoa, chocolate, herbs and coffee.  Flavour As Well full of roast liqourice Brown sugar, coffe and herbs. Medium to full bodied. Roasted sweet bitterness in the end has a medium chili touch on lips and Palate. Nice and pleasant.

0,33 l. bottle. Black colour with a creamy light tanned head. Roasted aroma with Mexican-style spices: Chilli, syrup, and chocolate malts. Some soft hop and yeast notes. Taste is light roasted and spicy with a discrete  sweetness from cocoa. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonated. Finishes spicy and roasted with a long lasting malt/spices note. Excellent spiced-up porter.

Bottle at home. Pours pitch black with a creamy steady brown head. The aroma is hard roasted malt, liquorice, chili, hops, smoke and bitter chocolate. The flavour has a herbal touch among with the hard roasted malt, the chili and the chocolate. Also notes of citris fruity hops, nuts, smoke and charcoal. Truely one of a kind but very tasty indeed.

A absolute black beauty with a potent dark brown head with a frothy attitude that stays. The aroma is first of all roasted with nutty side notes with nicely smokey hints. The taste is quite complex but at the same time very fine and easy to drink. Fine impressions of different spices and a mild chilli in the finish as a mild burn. A dark bitter roastyness with some chocolate and nuts. The palate is medium to light eeven though you feel this is a pretty big beer.  One of the best beers I have had for a while. Cheers - big time.

Tap @ C4, Odense. Pours black with a creamy head and lacings. Nose is hard roast, Chocolate and chili. Flavor is hard roasted coffee, chili , Chocolate and bitter hops. A bit unrefined and Odd. Warming finish. Tasty nevertheless.

Rating #724, bottle from Toft Vin. Some of my keys dont work any more, so Im not able to use html, but Ill throw in a review any way. Well, of course as expected this is a completely black beer, and the head is light brown and extremely potent when the beer is poured. Futhermore, its really stable and would probably look like whipped cream until tomorrow if Id let it. Extremely thick lacings. Aroma is obvious chocolate, coffee, spices and a bit tart. Hops and sweet malts, though at the same time roasted. A typical close-to-perfect Mikkeller stout aroma. The taste, oh the taste - at first a bit sweet & sour contrasts, then the sweetness breaks through and lets me taste some chocolate, before turning more roasted and coffee like, just to end in a nice, quite strong, bitter finish. The chili is there as well, but not as progressive as expected (maybe because I just ate a garlic bread an hour ago), but I like the subdued strengthness of the chili. Dots a tiny bit on the tongue.  Palate is soft and creamy. A very nice brew indeed.

On tap at Christian Firtal. Black with a lasting light brown head. Aroma of sweet licorice, dark chocolate, caramel and pepper. There is a lot going on here. Sweetish, full bodied dark malt flavour with character of chocolate and licorice with a touch of charcoal. Floral, spicy and herbal undertones. In the end comes a sneaking chili heat and a good hoppy bitterness. Lots of weird stuff thrown into this, but in the end its just a really good base beer.

FLÖSKA. Totally pitch black colour with a huge very well LAsting head indeed, brown and creamy, so creamy...  so very nize! Almost annoying how long the head takes to settle.. I wanna taste the beer! Lovely aroma of well roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, pepper and spice, in harmony, so well balanced. Good filling mouthfeel. The flavour is lovely, lots of roasted malt indeed with chocolate, coffee, spice, chili (medium), dark fruit and liqourice and pepper. The pepper part is just so good with all the rest in this so very tasty brew. Not too much roastiness, not too sweet, just so darn puta madre muy buena compadre way! Yum! Yum! Yum!
Bottle.Pitch black colour with creamy beige head.Aroma is spicey of pepper and chilli,flavor is rosted with hint of licorice and coffee,nice well spicey and good full body.

Draft. A pitch black beer with a huge dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, chilis, other spices, and chocolate. The flavor is sweet with notes of chocolate, chilis, roasted malt, alcohol, and other spices, lrading to a dry, roasted, and chocolaty finish.

13-APR-2012, bottle @home, from "Ølbutikken".
Black with yellow hue and a huge, lasting brown head. 
Nose is quite smokey. Layers of roasted, burnt malt, and a herbal, almost minty note. 
Taste the same with more spice and even more roast. Almost astringent malty. High carbonation, a little thin bodied. Ends bitter, also fron hops. And the chili? Weaker than the other "Rangers". Fine brew but more smoked than mexican...

(33 cl bottle from Toft Vin; BBD: March 12th 2016) Pours black with rich, crema-like brown head. Pretty lace and decent retention. Porter-like dark aroma with a clear presence of hops. Notes of smoke and something akin to licorice. Creamy texture, medium body - which is nice since it doesnt get too heavy - soft carbonation with a lingering, bitter finish. Flavour is like a smooth porter a moderate bitterness on the back that seems dark and peppery. Nicely rounded and not too agressive - despite the chilis. Girlfriend says: "I think its difficult because weve eaten the Mexican food and I dont know which part is giving taste to what Im drinking."

On tap at Mikkeller Bar. Black with a small brown head. rich  complex taste with a heavy bitternes. Full body. Taste of cola, cardamom and slightly of chili. long bitter aftertaste. (note. served to cold)

On tap at Mikkeller Bar. Pours black with a light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, spices, herbs, hops and some wood. Fruity and bitter with a very light chilli sting on the tounge. Spices reminds me a bit about christmas. Complex and intense with a full body. Hoppy and spicy with a dry and bitter finish. Interesting and very nice! (2012-04-06)

On tap. Pours an opaque black with a dense and creamy light brown head. Very fresh roasty nose with very subdued imprints of the massive array of spices. Medium body, great and chewy roastiness, slightly sweet with a vanilla whiff. Has a distinct malt bitter finish. Very high drinkability in this one. Basically just a very, very good Porter - all the hip ingredients are very subdued which to me is quite good news. 070412

From tap at MikkellerBar. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma is smooth fruity hoppy, toasted dark malty, chocolate, bitter and smooth fruity. Light chli bite int the finish. Rather hoppy and more like a black ipa than a spice/herb/vegetable. Vague smoked touch too.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Black coloured with a small beige head.
Roasted aroma of caramel and coffee with notes of chocolate and spices.
Roasted flavour of chocolate, spices and fruits.
Roasted finish.

Draught at Mikkeller. Pitch black and completely opaque with a massive grainy looking brown head. Roasted malts, chili, tequila-notes, coffee, licorice and green vegetables  - complex, herbal aroma. The taste is sweet with coffee, licorice, woody notes and subdued chili, leading to a dry bitter finish. Different. Intense. Good.
Draught at MikkellerBAR. Pitch black - brown head. Licorice. Nice smokey notes. Beans. Light chili notes. Vegetables. Cooca. Fruity. Light bread. Light grainy. Food taste and aroma.
